6D6166C317594A728637F7910282495A.description: Solve, using a variety of strategies including interpolation and extrapolation, contextual problems that involve data analysis and graphs.

82C1EB189F6340ACAFC1963897134117.description: Explain, using examples: how the same graph can be used to justify more than one conclusion, how different graphic representations of the same data set can be used to emphasize a point of view, what happens if the graph is drawn to the wrong scale, why the graph selected is not reflective of the data set.

1D96228957B94BC1B18AC3DDB7CF4D13.description: Analyze graphs including bar graphs, histograms, line graphs, and circle graphs to determine and describe trends.

5343356553A0479CA532D2B075554909.description: Critique the statement, “All histograms are bar graphs and all bar graphs are histograms."

AB0939B56ECA401C954E0E170046AA42.description: Analyze sets of data in a variety of contexts to determine and create, with or without technology, possible graphs that could be used to represent the data and explain the advantages and disadvantages of each graph.

D1C384F5B3654E27A21027D130C1551F.description: Analyze and compare sets of bar graphs and histograms.

0A317B19F1904B9CB1F39AF6DBA060BA.description: Pose questions that could be answered using histograms, construct the histogram, and draw conclusions.

5BC8B21F18BF4D5E87231E8524A6888D.description: Extend and apply understanding of representing data using graphs including: bar graphs, histograms, line graphs and circle graphs.

CEFFFDC7E9F042589E832C835DD3A0E0.description: Explain the importance of scale in mathematical drawings and/or in situational applications.

9CED5F34B42A47DAB24A589B2E86897C.description: Solve situational questions that involve scale and explain the reasoning.

A680D3E02C334A388B9EAD397AA67107.description: Draw, with or without technology, a scale diagram of 3-D objects.

E52D4300043D41008086FE0610C683BE.description: Construct models of 3-D objects, given the scale.

0AAB117DB1F84FB5A3E3459A24F0DDCB.description: Determine, using proportional reasoning, the dimensions of objects, given scale drawings or models.

99CC4747AC8E43A0B1FD4CA441CA5A66.description: Describe, using examples, contexts in which scale representations are used.

4335ECCC425B4331AC0A56AA7FF8DDA9.description: Solve, using personal strategies such as applying proportions or interpreting tables, situational questions that involve conversions of units within and between SI and/or imperial systems of measurement (e.g., km to m or km/h to ft/sec).

1184065567974342823F627218D50975.description: Explain, using examples, how unit analysis and proportional reasoning are related (e.g., to change km/h to km/min, multiply by 1h/60min because hours and minutes are proportional or have a constant relationship).

F7A72B0D94F94098B01D6E634C594FBF.description: Solve situational questions, using unit analysis, and explain the reasoning.

8DBD706F45CF4D49B6EAB080BF9E1133.description: Explain the process of unit analysis used to solve a problem (e.g., given km/h and time in hours, determine how many km; given revolutions per minute, determine the number of revolutions per second).

7EA9EF7B50DF40CB8D99CDDF8E0D648F.description: Extend and apply proportional thinking to solve problems that involve unit analysis and scale.

7CDFC5557FCC4CDCBE22C24BC1A87DAD.description: Solve situational questions that involve slope or rate of change, verify and explain why solutions are reasonable or not.

5CE319088DB242618CB7C3B36DF23477.description: Analyze, generalize, and explain, using illustrations, the relationship between slope and angle of elevation (e.g., for a ramp (or pitch of a roof, grade on a road, slope in pipes for plumbing, azimuth in the sky) that has a slope of 7:100, the angle of elevation is approximately 4 degrees).

A33C09F932E3452BB20839E8B2AE57B0.description: Analyze slopes of objects, such as ramps or roofs, to determine if the slope is constant and explain the reasoning.

073F1AE8C7254AA5B6B2EE16DA13B868.description: Justify, using examples and illustrations: slope as rise over run and slope as rate of change.

EF44C79A6DA6430090F8C6E3F229B6D2.description: Critique the statement, “It requires less effort to independently use a wheelchair to climb a ramp of a certain height that has a slope of 1:12 rather than a slope of 1:18."

6A7618860EFA438B986724F2613014CE.description: Describe conditions under which a slope will be either 0 or undefined and explain the reasoning.

1801B06E9985475782F13FD5614D6784.description: Analyze and generalize relationships between slopes in given contexts such as 3:1 and a 1:3 roof pitch or slopes that are usually described by a colour for downhill skiing and snowboarding, and explain implications of each slope including safety and functionality.

05F1FA92D1E24E0CB25240E008D71BCE.description: Research and present contexts that involve slope including the mathematics involved (e.g., ramps, roofs, road grade, flow rates within a tube, skateboard parks, ski hills).

25599127BD1E432AA7452259F02D1596.description: Demonstrate concretely, pictorially, and symbolically (with and without the use of technology) an understanding of slope with respect to: rise over run, rate of change and solving problems.

660DB6AFCF344100856799727857CB73.description: Critique the statement, “It is always better to have the lowest possible limit on a credit card.

1D48B2322ACE499DA1D3FCADB069E06F.description: Solve situational questions that involve credit linked to sales promotions, credit cards, or loans.

6883616544A34B8BA15E586DE85C665E.description: Describe strategies to use credit effectively, such as negotiating interest rates, planning payment timelines, reducing accumulated debt, and timing purchases.

87938AFBC67640C2AF254AB037C6BC1A.description: Analyze credit options related to the use of credit, such as service charges, interest, payday loans, and sales promotions, to make informed decisions and plans and explain the reasoning.

F500360939384771B9D21E3E11BF7A12.description: Research, compare, and report on credit card options from various companies and financial institutions.

055583F80D63491DAC30E24EB8B520A7.description: Describe ways that try to ensure the security of personal and financial information (e.g., passwords, encryption, protection of personal identification number (PIN) and other personal identity information).

108663D1ADFD45ABB982BE9F5EDF3DC3.description: Describe the advantages and disadvantages of: online banking, debit card purchases, different types of credit options, including bank and store credit cards, personal loans, lines of credit, and overdraft.

ABC3973A5AA54854A015FD6ACF4F00F2.description: Research and explain various automated teller machine (ATM) service charges.

B3AE703DF9B34F78BABDFED857F78440.description: Analyze given or personal situations to determine the type of account that best meets the needs of the criteria for each of the situations.

6333B07CC04548A08489F2F191905F28.description: Research and present orally, with the aid of visuals (electronic or other), various types of banking services available from various financial institutions, such as online services, different types of accounts, telephone banking, mobile banking, ATM banking, or credit cards.

1FE079333019469A8E2C9338E320720B.description: Demonstrate understanding of financial institution services used to access and manage personal finances, including credit options.

F9684E5598174454B07C0867AE7D8754.description: Estimate, using the Rule of 72, the time required for a given investment to double in value and explain the reasoning.

D04A6E9F8810455A9DFEC05B79D74808.description: Explain, using examples, the effect of changing different factors on compound interest such as different compounding periods, different interest rates, and starting at a younger age.

B818CDB899DB4B44AF0EAD4DDD9AF651.description: Solve, using a formula, situational questions that involve compound interest.

7413E7B17B4646BEB316B821A24012DB.description: Analyze and generalize the relationship between simple interest and compound interest.

9C00EC708B3847B5A78D21436F871B63.description: Solve situational questions that involve simple interest, given three of the four values in the formula I=prt and explain the reasoning.

B620C108F9F342FBB3868AE876DE33C6.description: Explain, using examples, the advantages of creating personal budgets.

352B35BB7CDE4F3DBE585293384D5BEC.description: Investigate and analyze, with or without technology, “what if …” questions related to personal budgets.

A078BC1F174B4C34AAD1BF435D6FF09B.description: Modify a budget to achieve a set of personal goals

9B5149B9B1BF45EF9FF5CF18BC227AA6.description: Create a personal budget based on given income and expense data or from personally collected data and justify the reasoning.

164749B02C0840D0B1DCFE33C0707E2F.description: Explain considerations that must be made when developing a budget (e.g., prioritizing, recurring and unexpected expenses).

6ED5B19341604F008FBB53592DBF90A1.description: Identify and justify income and expenses that could be included in a personal budget.

3CA4F1EF723A4504B986D70EFDDCDBEE.description: Demonstrate understanding of personal budgets and their importance for financial planning.

EC2B27DB10F440DC83D5F49BC4D10126.description: Identify and justify the point of perspective of given one-point perspective drawings of 3-D objects.

8E6E6467D94C42BE88A38A421FA905F0.description: Analyze a set of views of 3-D objects to determine if they represent a given object and explain the reasoning.

94830CD6C0EB418B821332D71F14DF53.description: Construct models of 3-D objects, given the top, front, and side views.

15D734A345334B04B2A385F078D4E636.description: Draw to scale: top, front, and side views of given actual 3-D objects, the components of a 3-D object.

EB6AE1ECE53C48DC897CA1E31ECF6C95.description: Describe and sketch or draw, with or without technology, using a variety of strategies including the use of isometric paper: 2-D representations of 3-D objects relevant to self, family, and community, 3-D objects, given the top, front, and side views, a one-point perspective view of given 3-D objects, the components of given exploded diagrams, and explain their relationship to the original 3-D objects, 2-D representations of 3-D objects, given their exploded view.

87D05E70724944C197186B58057B1470.description: Extend and apply understanding of 3-D objects including: • top, bottom, and side views • exploded views • component parts • scale diagrams.

B2DAD356A9054DD3B21CA534AE1E8CCE.description: Apply personal strategies including the primary trigonometric ratios to solve situational questions that involve: angles of elevation or angles of depression, and explain the reasoning, more than two right triangles and explain the reasoning.

B2ECCC2B7FC84500980F1C2C6DB529B3.description: Sketch representations of 2-D shapes or 3-D objects from given contexts or situations.

43F86D9ADE774DE090834E3F434DC811.description: Apply personal strategies to determine, with justification, if solutions to problems that involve two or three right triangles are reasonable.

03FAC4D5D3574643A3BB33F2938616F7.description: Analyze and sort a set of illustrations of triangles in a given context according to whether they are right triangles or not, and justify the sort.

CE007A91B0A940908279559FA63E2A16.description: Solve problems that involve at least two right triangles.

EA25AF5477F04781AA8A3DB3E7B56800.description: Solve using a variety of strategies, including the manipulation of formulae, situational questions that involve: the surface area of 3-D objects, including spheres, the volume of 3-D objects, including composite 3-D objects and the capacity of containers.

123D4BE1E87241319E870648D8FC44D7.description: Analyze and illustrate, using examples, the effect of dimensional changes on area, surface area, and volume.

CB4E19A11F5443F8ACA446824FAF331D.description: Analyze and generalize the relationship between the volumes of: cones and cylinders with the same base and height and pyramids and prisms with the same base and height.

B4541165D27140168E9453B2E8990948.description: Determine the capacity of prisms, cones, pyramids, spheres, and cylinders, using a variety of measuring tools and methods, such as graduated cylinders, measuring cups, measuring spoons, and displacement and explain the strategy used.

E5B6495613A748988641329C384BCC0C.description: Determine the surface area and volume of prisms, cones, cylinders, pyramids, spheres, and composite 3-D objects, using a variety of measuring tools such as rulers, tape measures, callipers, and micrometers and explain the strategy used including the manipulation of formulae.

86F0DD6618944123BDC678F8060F9530.description: Convert given volume, surface area, and capacity measurements: expressed in one SI unit to another SI unit (including units squared and units cubed) and expressed in one imperial unit to another imperial unit (including units squared and units cubed).

FEEF3C16EF9E4429A7206D007A3999AE.description: Solve situational questions that involve: the volume of 3-D objects and composite 3-D objects in a variety of contexts and the capacity of containers.

0CBD1014A0F04F4C9266E9C10D3C801B.description: Justify and apply strategies including use of personal referents to estimate the surface area and volume of 3-D objects, and the capacity of containers.

FC8C89E15CDD4476B68A5BA3A728CBBB.description: Justify and compare the choice of personal referents for surface area, volume, and capacity measurements in both SI and imperial units, (e.g., The bottom half of a two-litre carton of milk has a capacity of one litre, a surface area of 500 cm2 or if a top was added to make a prism it would have a surface area of 600 cm2 and a volume of about 1000 cm3, or the volume of a box for hockey helmets is approximately 1 ft³ [1800 in³] and the surface area is about 6 ft² [900 in²]).

4BB3AEEF43C44A179CA4F3340327E85F.description: Identify and describe situations in which given SI or imperial volume or capacity units would be used.

7557CB1EF9E74D52AA596A7CC68B16A2.description: Critique the statement: “Volume and capacity represent the same attribute to measure so the same units of measure can be used for either volume or capacity”

21D227B5E8DF463296E2570512A022E2.description: Observe, analyze, and compare volume and capacity using examples.

0318C4A9C7C54C8EBB8DB8DCD750E863.description: Observe, analyze, generalize, and explain using examples including nets, the relationships between area, surface area, and volume.

3C81E09F3BE1443F8DF876A361DF7586.description: Extend and apply understanding of surface area, volume, and capacity using concrete and pictorial models and symbolic representations (SI or imperial units of measurement).

22AFE4C1B52244BE8A70BC11059785BB.description: Create a variation of a puzzle or a game, and describe a strategy for solving the puzzle or winning the game.

A042BBE538D64612A56BC674FB2DC5E0.description: Observe and analyze errors in solutions to puzzles or in strategies for winning games to identify and correct errors, if necessary, and explain the reasoning.

5512D7CC50F14590AC5738BAF269A2EE.description: Determine, explain, and verify strategies to solve a puzzle or to win a game such as: guess and check, look for a pattern, make a systematic list,  draw or model, eliminate possibilities, formulate and simplify a problem that is similar to the original problem, work backwards and develop alternative approaches.

277BEBEA1A9B417D956749A6AAD2F518.description: Demonstrate the ability to analyze puzzles and games that involve numerical reasoning and problem solving strategies

25B7AE66EDC246DB909D52E49A10B0E8.description: Solve, with or without the use of technology, situational questions that involve the application of a formula that: does not require manipulation and does require manipulation.

AD6DEE691FB24FD0AB7718D498607B1C.description: Analyze solutions to questions that involve formulae to verify the preservation of equality, correct if necessary, and explain the reasoning.

487A76E216E6425091C58F253FF5DBBC.description: Create, solve, and verify the reasonableness of solutions to situational questions that involve the use of a formula relevant to self, family, or community.

8AA0B4798B824370B18C582BE55024D8.description: Describe, using examples, how a given formula is used in a trade or an occupation.

8690F28DAAE941B3B25DB41C2A1FC602.description: Verify whether given forms of the same formula are equivalent and justify the conclusion.

F3736CE64AC74A2BBB4420F90B332EF4.description: Verify, using examples, and explain why different forms of the same formula are equivalent.

CCFB7FFBF1C948EE807D5181C5625810.description: Expand and apply understanding of the preservation of equality including solving problems that involve the manipulation and application of formulae for volume and capacity, surface area, slope and rate of change, simple interest, and finance charges.
